attributes.action: Give all A level students their centre assessed / predicted grades not algorithm
attributes.additional_details: Through no fault of their own, thousands of state school pupils have been robbed of grades they were on target to achieve. Places at University have been lost, lives are in chaos. Students are made to feel grateful to be awarded their Mock results, which most go on to surpass in final exams. Others have been downgraded beyond previous attainment levels. This cannot be right ! The algorithm is not fit for purpose and grossly distorts representation of student's capabilities. Use Predicted Grades
attributes.background: Treat all students equally. Give them the predicted grades they have earned and been rigorously assessed to achieve by their qualified, professional  teachers. Disregard marking by algorithm - it is unfit for purpose and has been proven to disproportionately advantage those in private education.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013
